subject: FEE
text: Using node voltage analysis, determine the node voltages: V1, V2, V3 and hence find the current

subject: FEE
text: For the circuit shown below, obtain the value of R so that maximum power is dissipated in it. Also, determine the maximum power. What will be the power dissipated in R if R is made 1.25 times the source (Thevenin's) resistance.

subject: FEE
text: A series resonance network consisting of a resistor of 30 Ω, a capacitor of 2 µF and an inductor of 20 mH is connected across a sinusoidal supply voltage which has a constant output of 9 Volts at all frequencies. Calculate the resonant frequency, the current at resonance, the voltage across the inductor and capacitor at resonance, the quality factor and the bandwidth of the circuit.

subject: FEE
text: Three similar coils with a resistance of 7 Ω and an inductance of 0.03 H each are connected in delta configuration to a 400 V, 3-phase, 50 Hz supply system in RYB sequence. Using VRY as the reference voltage phasor, determine (a) the phase currents, (b) the line currents, and (c) the active, reactive and apparent powers.

subject: FEE
text: A ring forming a magnetic circuit is made from two materials. One part is mild steel (relative permeability = 2000) of mean length 25 cm and cross-sectional area 4 cm², and the remainder is cast iron (relative permeability = 1350) of mean length 20 cm and cross-sectional area 7.5 cm². Determine the total reluctance of the circuit. Calculate the MMF required to create a flux density of 0.75 Tesla in the steel part of the magnetic circuit.

subject: FEE
text: Explain the concept of electromagnetic induction using an example of a transformer. A 10 kVA, 415 / 11000 V, 50 Hz, single-phase transformer has 60 turns on the primary. Determine the maximum flux in the core.

subject: FEE
text: Describe the major components in a digital energy meter. Mention any two advantages of digital energy meters over analog energy meters.

subject: FEE
text: Explain the power connection setup required for critical loads and illustrate it with a block diagram.

subject: FEE
text: Explain the function of a full wave rectifier and how it differs from a half wave rectifier in terms of output voltage.

subject: FEE
text: Explain how an ELCB (Earth Leakage Circuit Breaker) functions to protect against leakage currents.

subject: FEE
text: Describe the different types of power converters used in Electric Vehicles (EVs) and their functions.
